column5: Finally did my bucket list trip this week and hit up Clearwater for the Tarpon run. My friend who runs charters told me to prepare for an A*s Kicking but I had no idea that he meant that literally! We went 2-6 bagging a 110 and 184 pound Tarpon that took 1 and 2.5 hours to haul in. Incredible runs and jumps from these beasts! After the 184 my back and hands had nothing left so we spent an hour casting for trout in the back channels lol. Incredible experience and cant wait to do it again when I recover lol https://youtu.be/zWiykLdbcNI
how do you determine the weight of a 184 lbs fish, im assuming rapala digital scale?Â ðŸ¤£  seriously unreal though. What an experience.
Lol he was able to take the girth and length and plug it into his app. Iâ€™m considering it gospel haha
Years ago my barber used to make a trip down there once a year for tarpon, some big fish! LOL wanna go? no! fight one fish for an hour or more? too much like work!
Inshore tarpon is definitely on my bucket list!
Great catches. I have thought about doing a charter like that also.
